Paragraph: In the fight against global diseases, it's important to remember that COVID-19 still poses a significant threat. Malaria, Tuberculosis, Diabetes, and Cancer are also major health concerns that require ongoing efforts to prevent and treat.

So the entities are COVID-19, Malaria, Tuberculosis, and Diabetes, as mentioned in the paragraph. Cancer is also included based on the context of the paragraph, even though it is not explicitly mentioned in the given sentence.

Chemical.content:
Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: KEY POINTS : .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| hydrogen peroxide (H2O2) |
| sodium hydroxide (NaOH) |
| hydrochloric acid (HCl) |
| ethanol (C2H5OH) |
| acetic acid (CH3COOH) |
| potassium iodide (KI) |
| iodine (I2) |
| starch |
| glucose (C6H12O6) |

Paragraph: In a test tube, add a few drops of hydrochloric acid to a solution of hydrogen peroxide. Observe the reaction. Add a few grains of potassium iodide and a few drops of starch solution. The blue color of the starch will turn colorless, indicating the complete decomposition of hydrogen peroxide. In another test tube, add a few drops of hydrochloric acid to a solution of sodium hydroxide. Observe the vigorous reaction. In a third test tube, add a few drops of hydrochloric acid to a solution of ethanol and a few grains of iodine. Observe the absence of a reaction. In a fourth test tube, add a few drops of hydrochloric acid to a solution of acetic acid. Observe the formation of a gas and the appearance of a white precipitate. In a fifth test tube, add a few drops of hydrochloric acid to a solution of potassium iodide and a few grains of iodine. Observe the brown color of the iodine turning darker.

In this experiment, we used hydrochloric acid (HCl), hydrogen peroxide (H2O2), sodium hydroxide (NaOH), ethanol (C2H5OH), acetic acid (CH3COOH), potassium iodide (KI), and iodine (I2). We also used starch as an indicator and glucose (C6H12O6) as a reactant in one of the tests.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Chemical" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| hydrochloric acid (HCl) |
| hydrogen peroxide (H2O2) |
| sodium hydroxide (NaOH) |
| ethanol (C2H5OH) |
| acetic acid (CH3COOH) |
| potassium iodide (KI) |
| iodine (I2) |

Paragraph: In a test tube, add a few drops of hydrochloric acid to a solution of hydrogen peroxide. Observe the reaction. Add a few grains of potassium iodide and a few drops of starch solution. The blue color of the starch will turn colorless, indicating the complete decomposition of hydrogen peroxide. In another test tube, add a few drops of hydrochloric acid to a solution of sodium hydroxide. Observe the vigorous reaction. In a third test tube, add a few drops of hydrochloric acid to a solution of ethanol and a few grains of iodine. Observe the absence of a reaction. In a fourth test tube, add a few drops of hydrochloric acid to a solution of acetic acid. Observe the formation of a gas and the appearance of a white precipitate. In a fifth test tube, add a few drops of hydrochloric acid to a solution of potassium iodide and a few grains of iodine. Observe the brown color of the iodine turning darker.

The paragraph refers to the following chemicals: hydrochloric acid (HCl), hydrogen peroxide (H2O2), sodium hydroxide (NaOH), ethanol (C2H5OH), acetic acid (CH3COOH), potassium iodide (KI), and iodine (I2). Starch is not a chemical, but a biopolymer used as an indicator in the experiment. Glucose is a reactant in one of the tests, but it is not mentioned as a chemical entity in the paragraph.
